tooltips.checkSolvabilityFull: Check if this position can still be solved

solveRated.title: Rated Solve
solveRated.rule2: Using hints places the piece but awards no point (net 0).
solveRated.rule4: Undo is restricted to last move only.
solveRated.strategy: Strategy: This mode is for competitive solving. Plan your moves carefully!

solveUnrated.title: Unrated Solve
solveUnrated.rule1: Hints and solvability checks are free.
solveUnrated.rule3: This mode is for exploration and learning.
solveUnrated.tip: Relax and explore: Experiment freely without pressure!

success.title: Congratulations!
success.subtitle: Puzzle Solved!
success.autoSaved: ‚úÖ Your solution has been automatically saved!

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using KOOS Puzzle, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use this service.

license.title: 2. Use License
license.content: Permission is granted to temporarily use KOOS Puzzle for personal, non-commercial purposes. This license shall automatically terminate if you violate any of these restrictions and may be terminated by KOOS Puzzle at any time.

userContent.title: 3. User Content
userContent.content: Users may create and share puzzle designs and solutions. You retain ownership of your content but grant KOOS Puzzle a license to display and distribute your content within the platform. You are responsible for ensuring your content does not violate any laws or infringe on others' rights.

accountSecurity.title: 4. Account Security
accountSecurity.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials. You agree to notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account.

privacy.title: 5. Privacy Policy
privacy.content: Your privacy is important to us. We collect minimal personal information necessary for account functionality. Your email address and puzzle data are stored securely and will not be shared with third parties without your consent.

disclaimer.title: 6. Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: KOOS Puzzle is provided "as is" without any warranties, expressed or implied. We do not warrant that the service will be uninterrupted, timely, secure, or error-free.

liability.title: 7. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: In no event shall KOOS Puzzle be liable for any damages arising out of the use or inability to use the service, including but not limited to data loss or service interruptions.

modifications.title: 8. Modifications to Terms
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.

contact.title: 9. Contact Information
contact.content: For questions about these Terms & Conditions, please contact us through the support channels provided in the application.

emptyCells.title: Empty Cell Appearance
emptyCells.description: Control the appearance of neighbor cells (green spheres in add mode)
emptyCells.linkedMessage: Empty cells will match your environment material settings
emptyCells.customMessage: Empty cells use custom material settings below

presets.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this preset?

overview.title: Game Mode: Landmine
overview.description: Compete against the computer in turn-based puzzle assembly. Every move is final‚Äîdon't make the puzzle unsolvable!

placingPiece.title: Your Turn
placingPiece.rule: ‚Äì Place a piece: +1 point, turn passes to computer.

winLose.title: Win/Lose Conditions
winLose.lose: ‚Äì You LOSE if your move makes the puzzle unsolvable.
winLose.draw: ‚Äì DRAW if all pieces are placed and puzzle remains solvable.
winLose.noMoves: ‚Äì Game ends when no more moves are possible.

noUndos.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è No Take-Backs
noUndos.rule: Once a piece is placed, it cannot be removed. Choose carefully!

goal.label: Goal:
goal.description: Keep the puzzle solvable and score points. Don't be the one who breaks it!

placing.title: Drawing & Placing:
placing.step1: 1. Click on an empty cell in the container to start drawing.
placing.step2: 2. Continue clicking adjacent cells to define the 4-cell shape.
placing.step3: 3. The system will automatically match your drawn shape to a valid piece and place it.

selecting.title: Viewing Pieces:
selecting.action: ‚Äì Single-click on any placed piece to view it.

whatIs.title: What is Koos Puzzle?
whatIs.description: Koos Puzzle is a 3D puzzle platform where you can solve challenging sphere-based puzzles, create your own designs, and share them with a global community.

features.title: Key Features
features.solve: Solve puzzles manually or watch automated solutions
features.create: Design and publish your own 3D sphere puzzles
features.auto: Powerful AI solver with multiple strategies
features.share: Save and share your creations with the community

comingSoon.title: Coming Soon!
comingSoon.message: We're working hard to bring you this feature!

welcome.title: Assembly Guide
welcome.subtitle: Step-by-step help to build the physical puzzle
welcome.purpose: This page helps you assemble your physical KOOS Puzzle by showing you exactly how pieces fit together.
welcome.feature1Description: Use the reveal slider to show pieces one at a time in the correct assembly order.
welcome.feature2Description: Use the explosion slider to separate pieces and see how they connect.
welcome.feature3Description: Click the info button to see puzzle details, statistics, and creator information.
welcome.feature4Description: Change lighting and environment presets to get the best view for assembly.
welcome.feature5Description: Double-click any piece in the puzzle to open a detailed 3D view of that piece.

welcome.title: Create Your Puzzle
welcome.subtitle: Design and share your own 3D puzzle
welcome.purpose: This page lets you build custom KOOS Puzzles by adding cells to create unique 3D shapes that others can solve.
welcome.feature1Description: Click on the grid to add cells and build your puzzle shape. Click existing cells to remove them.
welcome.feature2Description: Drag to rotate the view and examine your puzzle from all angles as you build.
welcome.feature3Description: Use the camera controls to see how your puzzle will look from different perspectives.
welcome.feature4Description: Save your creation to your account and give it a name and description.
welcome.feature5Description: Publish your puzzle so others around the world can solve your unique design.

infoHub.title: Information & Help
infoHub.subtitle: Choose a topic to learn more

modeModal.ratedDescription: Rated mode tracks your score and challenges you to solve efficiently.
modeModal.ratedRule2: Using hints places the piece but awards no point (net 0)
modeModal.ratedRule4: Undo is restricted to last move only
modeModal.ratedStrategy: Strategy: This competitive mode rewards planning and efficient solving!
modeModal.unratedDescription: Unrated mode is perfect for exploration and learning without pressure.
modeModal.unratedTip: Relax and explore: This mode is designed for practice and discovery!

puzzleModal.title: About This Puzzle
puzzleModal.creator: Creator
puzzleModal.roughSearchSpace: Rough search space on the order of

controlsModal.title: How to Solve
controlsModal.intro: In manual mode you draw each Koos piece directly on the lattice.
controlsModal.drawPiece: Double-click adjacent empty cells to draw up to 4 spheres
controlsModal.cancelDrawing: Single-click on a cell to cancel the current drawing
controlsModal.selectPiece: Click a placed piece to select it
controlsModal.deletePiece: Double-click or long-press a selected piece to delete it
controlsModal.undoRedo: Use Ctrl+Z / ‚åòZ to undo and Shift+Ctrl+Z / Shift+‚åòZ to redo
controlsModal.modeUnique: Place each piece at most once
controlsModal.modeUnlimited: Use any piece as many times as you like
controlsModal.modeIdentical: The first piece you place becomes the only allowed piece
controlsModal.tipDescription: Use the gear icon (‚öôÔ∏è) to tune lighting and materials so the structure is easier to read while you explore

playInfoHub.title: Game Information
playInfoHub.subtitle: Choose a topic to learn more

howToPlayModal.title: How to Play
howToPlayModal.intro: Compete against the computer in turn-based puzzle assembly. Take turns placing pieces and try to outscore your opponent.

turnBased.title: Turns
turnBased.description: You and the computer take turns placing one piece at a time. A piece is shown on the board immediately, then the system checks if the puzzle is still solvable.

placing.title: How to Place a Piece
placing.step1: On your turn, draw up to 4 connected empty cells to form a piece shape.
placing.step2: The system identifies the matching piece and places it.

scoring.title: Valid vs Invalid Moves
scoring.validPlacement: Valid move: The piece stays, and you earn +1 point.
scoring.invalidPlacement: Invalid move: If the placement makes the puzzle unsolvable, the piece is removed with a short fade-out, you earn 0 points, and the turn passes.

hints.title: Solvability Indicator
hints.description: üü¢ Green: Puzzle is solvable | üü† Orange: Solvability unknown (still allowed) | üî¥ Red: This move is rejected and will be undone

visibility.title: Winning
visibility.description: The game ends only when the board is completely filled. The player with the higher score wins.

autoSolveInfoHub.title: Auto Solve Information
autoSolveInfoHub.subtitle: Choose a topic to learn more

howToModal.title: How to Auto Solve
howToModal.intro: Let the computer find solutions automatically using advanced search algorithms!

whatItDoes.title: What Auto Solve Does
whatItDoes.description: The computer attempts to find a valid solution by systematically exploring possible piece placements. This process may take time depending on puzzle complexity.

strategies.title: Solution Strategies
strategies.exhaustive: Exhaustive: Explores all possibilities thoroughly for guaranteed solutions
strategies.balanced: Balanced: Uses smart heuristics to find solutions efficiently
strategies.fast: Fast: Prioritizes speed with randomized search techniques

timeComplexity.title: Time & Complexity
timeComplexity.description: Solution time varies greatly based on puzzle size, piece count, and container constraints.
timeComplexity.factors: Larger search spaces may require minutes or longer. The solver will report progress and intermediate states.

controls.title: Controls
controls.start: Start: Begin the automated solving process
controls.stop: Stop: Halt the current solve attempt
controls.reveal: Reveal Slider: Show solution pieces incrementally
controls.explode: Explode Slider: Separate pieces to examine the structure

observation.title: Observation Mode
observation.description: Auto Solve is for observation, verification, and learning. Watch how the computer approaches the puzzle and learn from successful strategies.

verification.title: Solution Verification
verification.description: Use Auto Solve to verify that a puzzle you created is solvable, or to discover alternative solutions to known puzzles.

howToModal.tip: Complex puzzles may take longer to solve. Try different strategies if one doesn't find a solution quickly!

explanation.notYetDetermined: Solver has not yet determined solvability
